name: Introduction to Economics
description: This course provides an introduction to the fundamental concepts of economics such as supply and demand, opportunity cost, incentives, and market structure.

name: Intermediate Macroeconomics
description: This course covers more advanced topics in macroeconomics such as economic growth, inflation, unemployment, monetary and fiscal policy, and international economics.

name: Introduction to Public Economics
description: This course provides an introduction to public economics, including topics such as the welfare state, taxation, and public goods.

name: Advanced Public Economics
description: This course covers more advanced topics in public economics, such as the economics of taxation, social insurance, and the economics of the welfare state.
